content.title: Junior Merit (Class - 11 To 12)
content.details: The Government of Odisha in School & Mass Education Department is awarding 'Junior Merit Scholarship' under the Scheme 'e-medhabruti’ out of the State budget to provide financial assistance to the meritorious Higher Secondary School students of Odisha from families whose parental income does not exceed 6.00 lakhs to meet a part of their educational expenses while pursuing their higher studies.
benefits: The students pursuing Class XI & XII in the Higher Secondary Schools of the State will receive a scholarship amount of ₹3000/- per year.
The number of scholarships will be awarded to 10,000 students (Boys & Girls in 50:50 ratio).
eligibility: The student must be a permanent resident of Odisha State.
The Student must have passed HSC with 60% or more marks from an institution recognized by BSE Odisha, CBSE, ICSE, or Equivalent Boards, and pursuing regular Class XI courses of 10+2.
The income of the parents of the students from all sources should not exceed ₹6.00 lakh per annum.
Students shall apply for Junior Merit Scholarship in the 1st year of the course (Class XI).
The students belong to General, SC, ST, OBC/SEBC & EBC categories may eligible to apply.
exclusions: Students pursuing their higher study through distance learning/correspondence.
Students already availing scholarship for pursuing their study under any other schemes of State or Central Govt.
Students not validated by the concerned Principal/Institution during Class XI (1st year of his/her admission).
documents_required: Domicile certificate to be issued by the competent authority.
Proof of annual income to be issued by the competent authority.
Mark sheets & Certificate of last qualifying examination.
Bank Account details of the student concerned.
Higher Secondary School ID card issued by concerned authority.
Aadhaar Card of the student concerned.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the meritorious Higher Secondary School students of Odisha from families whose parental income does not exceed ₹6.00 lakhs to meet a part of their educational expenses while pursuing their higher studies.

faqs.question: What is the scholarship amount under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The students pursuing Class XI & XII in the Higher Secondary Schools of the State will receive a scholarship amount of ₹3000/- per year.

faqs.question: How many students will be given scholarships?
faqs.answer: The number of scholarships will be awarded to 10,000 students.

faqs.question: In which ratio the scholarship is distributed between boys & girls?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is distributed between boys & girls in 50:50 ratios.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The student of Class XI & XII who is a permanent resident of Odisha is eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum percentage of marks required to apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The Student must have passed HSC with 60% or more marks from an institution recognized by BSE Odisha, CBSE, ICSE, or Equivalent Boards, and pursuing regular Class XI courses of 10+2.

faqs.question: Which category of students can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The students belong to General, SC, ST, OBC/SEBC & EBC categories may eligible to apply.

faqs.question: When shall a student be eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students shall apply for Junior Merit Scholarship in the 1st year of the course (Class XI).

faqs.question: Can a student studying outside Odisha State be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Outside students (students of Odisha but studying outside Odisha) are also required to apply online for this scholarship.

faqs.question: Can a student pursuing study through distance learning/correspondence be eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, such students are not allowed to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can eligible students apply every year for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The eligible students may apply each year for the scholarship on the State Scholarship Portal.

faqs.question: Where can I register for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The eligible student can apply for the scholarship on the State Scholarship Portal: https://scholarship.odisha.gov.in/website/student-registration.

faqs.question: By whom will the application be validated?
faqs.answer: The application will be validated/authenticated by the Higher Secondary School/Institute.
